movies.title: Saba
movies.plot: A rework of Boris Sigal's play The Trial of Stepan Korolev. Set in Tbilisi rather than Leningrad is a morality tale about the hazards of alcohol consumption that is nonetheless not without humor.
movies.simplePlot: A rework of Boris Sigal's play The Trial of Stepan Korolev. Set in Tbilisi rather than Leningrad is a morality tale about the hazards of alcohol consumption that is nonetheless not without humor.

biography.bio: Aleksandre Jaliashvili was born on March 1, 1905. He was an actor and assistant director, known for Nail in the Boot (1931), Ukanaskneli maskaradi (1934) and Saba (1929). He died on January 24, 1981.
biography.name: Aleksandre Jaliashvili

biography.placeOfBirth: Kutaisi, Russian Empire [now Republic of Georgia]
biography.bio: Queen of Soviet theater. Although Veriko (she was always called by her first name) acted in dozens of films, she did not get the same success as Nato Vachnadze. But she was first on the stage, from her twenties till her death. Her part from Monanieba (1987) by Abuladze became a cult favorite. 'Is this way to the temple?' her character asks a victim of the Soviet regime. These words were later taken as a motto of Perestrojka.
biography.name: Veriko Anjaparidze

biography.bio: L. Januashvili is an actor, known for Saba (1929).
biography.name: L. Januashvili

actors.character: Vakhtangi, son of Saba and Maro

biography.bio: Eka Chavchavadze is an actress, known for Saba (1929).
biography.name: Eka Chavchavadze
